post.body: exactly!! plus was there really anyone else who could have played beast?
And Bill Bixby (Rip) as Bruce Banner William Defo as the Green Goblin I think the guy on the 40 year old Virgin would have been a great Bruce Banner in the Hulk who think so

user.username: No one on the corner has swagger like Chris

post.body: I hated that new Fantastic Four movie, but if I had to pick any of those that were good portrayals, I liked the guy who played The Thing. The rest: human torch: good looks doesn't equal good acting, he was more annoying than anything :P Jessica Alba..just no haha and Mr. Fantastic eh, I don't even remember his performance. Can't believe there's gonna be more :( Eric Bana was a pretty good Bruce Banner.

agreed, the lee/ditko era satrted it off, and the movie was based on those portrayls. but i would of felt a lot better watching a lee/romita style spidey, cause i believe this is where the stories became mature and peter grew into guy i would of liked to hang out with. the problem also being that the spidey movies are moving into the romita decade but the preformance is staying in the ditko, and while im sure the cgi will wow the audience i just know id never be able to just kick back with the peter on the big screen.
Christian Bale as Batman Hugh Jackman as Wolverine Wesley Snipes as Blade Christopher Reeves as Superman (I don't think anyone will be able to fill those shoes)
Christian Bale was brill as Batman As for Michael Keaton, he was probably the worst actor to play Batman.

Christian Bale as Batman. He really nailed the extreme, almost bipolar character split of Bruce Wayne/Batman. Second for me is Tobey McGuire as Spiderman. I thought he did a great job at capturing that awkward transition phase from teens to early adulthood, with the added pressure and duty of being a superhero. Fantastic job. Third on my list is Hugh Jackman as Wolverine. He's definitely got the attitude and internal strife thing down, and his action and use of the claws is superb. I just wish he was bigger.
